main event: A civilian in Ridgewood, New York reported a cigar-shaped, nearly white object, the size of a medium-shaped orange, falling from the vapor trails of a jet aircraft. The object was intercepted by a sector on the same date and was evaluated as a chief drop.
interesting points: The object appeared to be similar to a snowball in shape and disk-shaped before disappearing from view at a 45-degree angle.
It was observed to be falling from the vapor trails of a jet aircraft and intercepted by a fighter aircraft.
The witness was a 42-year-old teacher at CCNY and an alternate coach of the U.S. Olympic fencing team.
The preliminary analysis suggested that the object could be a weather balloon based on its description of being pearly white and snowball-shaped.

Attempts were made to secure information from New York Control and the 26th Air Defense reports B47 aircraft with fighter interceptor attempts being made in the eastern Pennsylvania areas on the same date.
